wikitext.*:
'''Sir Gawain and the Green Knight''' is a [[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight (poem)|14th century Middle English manuscript]]. Here, it can refer to: 

==Publications==
* ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight (edition)|Sir Gawain and the Green Knight]]'', the [[1925]] edition by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[E.V. Gordon]].
* Stanza 32 of ''Sir Gawain and the Green Knight'', translated by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]], a frament included in [[1961]] in ''[[A Short History of English Poetry]]''.
* ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Pearl and Sir Orfeo]]'' by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]], a book published posthumously in [[1975]], with the full translation of the poem along with ''Pearl'' and ''[[Sir Orfeo (booklet)|Sir Orfeo]]''.
* [[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight (lecture)]], delivered by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] in [[1953]] as part of the [[W.P. Ker Lecture]] series and later reprinted in [[The Monsters and the Critics, and Other Essays]].
